intro: Hartiana tenella, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Hartiana tenella thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
